H0.text: Mushrooms are specialized reproductive structures that fungi often make.

H1.text: Pieces are specialized reproductive structures that fungi often make.

H2.text: Fungus is a specialized reproductive structure that fungi often make.

H3.text: Herbs are specialized reproductive structures that fungi often make.

A4.text: A mushroom is the fleshy, sporeâ€‘bearing fruiting body of a fungus, typically produced above ground on soil or another food source.

A5.text: The most important microscopic feature for identification of mushrooms is the spores. Their color, shape, size, attachment, ornamentation, and reaction to chemical tests often can be the crux of an identification.
